item.title: Coronavirus: Johnson sets out 'ambitious' economic recovery plan
item.description: Boris Johnson vows a "new deal" for UK after coronavirus - but Labour says saving jobs is top priority.

item.title: Leicester lockdown: City 'must stick together' after coronavirus surge
item.description: Leicester's mayor tells people to stay at home as the UK's first local lockdown is imposed.

item.title: Death rate 'back to normal' in UK
item.description: It is the first time weekly deaths have been below the five-year average since mid March.

item.title: Theresa May criticises PM over choice of Brexit envoy for security role
item.description: Theresa May questions Brexit envoy David Frost's qualifications to replace Sir Mark Sedwill in role.

item.title: 'We will get married and then go home'
item.description: Engaged couples react as England lifts its ban on weddings from 4 July - but with strict rules.

item.title: EasyJet plans to close bases and cut staff
item.description: The airline says it has begun consultations on plans to close bases at Stansted, Southend and Newcastle.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK economy hit by worst contraction in 41 years
item.description: The economy contracted by more than first estimated between January and March, revised figures show.

item.title: Hong Kong: UK says new security law is 'deeply troubling'
item.description: China has "ignored its international obligations regarding Hong Kong", says the foreign secretary.

item.title: Rental e-scooters to be made legal on UK roads from Saturday
item.description: The government is set to say hired, but not private, e-scooters will be allowed on roads from Saturday.

item.title: Kelly Fauvrelle: Pregnant woman 'killed by ex in cowardly attack'
item.description: Kelly Fauvrelle was stabbed 21 times. Her baby was delivered by caesarean but died four days later.

item.title: Carl Reiner: US comedy star dies at 98
item.description: The veteran actor, comedian and writer also starred in Ocean's Eleven as conman Saul Bloom.

item.title: Peep Show blackface scene removed from Netflix but remains on C4
item.description: But it's still on Channel 4, who say they don't think "erasing our creative history is a quick fix".

item.title: Leicester lockdown: 'Shocked' residents prepare for new restrictions
item.description: People in Leicester city centre react to the UK's first local lockdown which was imposed on Monday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mal Martin due home after 'miracle' recovery
item.description: Mal Martin's family were told there was almost zero chance of survival after he contracted Covid-19.

item.title: 100 days of lockdown: How life changed in the town of Telford
item.description: What's lockdown been like for personal trainer, a student, a rapper and a semi-pro footballer?

item.title: Liverpool city centre zip wire attraction gets green light
item.description: The aerial zip wire attraction will run from St John's Beacon to Liverpool Central Library.

item.title: Israel annexation: What is the West Bank?
item.description: Concerns have been expressed around the world over plans by Israelâ€™s prime minister to annex parts of the West Bank.

item.title: Family rescue bear cub swimming with a jar stuck on its head
item.description: Tricia Hurt's family were fishing in Wisconsin when they spotted the animal in need of a helping hand.

item.title: Coronavirus: Choir song honours health and care workers who have died
item.description: Composer Howard Goodall's new song features the names of over a hundred NHS and care home workers who have died.

item.title: Protest rights: 'We have a right to protest despite coronavirus'
item.description: Lawyer Christian Weaver posts videos online teaching the law in 60 seconds.

item.title: Young skater goes viral performing at Black Lives Matter Plaza
item.description: A video of Kaitlyn Saunders skating on the square opposite the White House has amassed over 350,000 views.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain's Alhambra Palace reopens to visitors
item.description: After a three-month closure due to coronavirus, the monument in Granada has once again opened its doors.

item.title: Coronavirus: The Ipswich salon where mum can work but daughter cannot
item.description: A mother and daughter air their frustration at new post-lockdown guidance affecting their salon.

item.title: Rankin portraits celebrate NHS workers during pandemic
item.description: Photographer Rankin photographed 12 people whose jobs have been critical during the pandemic.

item.title: Behind the scenes of Stormzy's Glastonbury set
item.description: How the creative directors of Stormzy's 2019 performance created a defining Glastonbury moment.

item.title: Leicester lockdown: Parents and pupils upset at school closures
item.description: Leicester's schools will be closed from Thursday as the city tackles a spike in Covid-19 cases.

item.title: 'Don't call me BAME': Why some people are rejecting the term
item.description: The term BAME has been growing in prominence - but many say it does more harm than good.

item.title: 'My 30-year struggle with racism in the Metropolitan police'
item.description: Former senior police officer Shabnam Chaudhri says she was unfairly treated, because of her ethnicity.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I felt least afraid when the pandemic started'
item.description: When lockdown began Seaneen Molloy's panic attacks stopped, but as restrictions are eased, her anxiety is returning.

item.title: â€˜Trump political base hit hardest by coronavirus'
item.description: Covid-19 has hit President Trump's political base the hardest, says White House economic adviser.

item.title: Civil service: What changes does the government want to make?
item.description: There are 450,000 civil servants working in the UK, but what do they do?

item.title: Could a boycott kill Facebook?
item.description: As Ford, Adidas, Microsoft and HP pause ads on the social network, should Facebook be worried?

item.title: Coronavirus: How much does your boss need to know about you?
item.description: Firms are collecting a lot more information about staff as they try to contain coronavirus risks.

item.title: The Last Leg's Alex Brooker: 'Viewers don't define me by my disability'
item.description: The Last Leg star Alex Brooker on how the show helped change perceptions of disabled people.

item.title: Stokes to captain England in first West Indies Test
item.description: Ben Stokes will captain England for the first time after confirmation Joe Root will miss the first Test against West Indies.

item.title: Premier League offers women's football Â£1m to help start 2020-21 season
item.description: The Premier League offers women's football Â£1m to help enable the 2020-21 season to start, chief executive Richard Masters tells MPs.

item.title: 'F1 drivers have discussed taking a knee at first grand prix'
item.description: McLaren's Lando Norris says Formula 1 drivers have discussed 'taking a knee' at the season-opening Austrian Grand Prix this weekend.

item.title: 'I cannot believe racing is still going ahead' - runners withdrawn from Leicester meeting
item.description: Several runners are withdrawn by trainers from racing at Leicester after Tuesday's meeting was cleared to go ahead despite new city lockdown rules.

item.title: 'Rat!' 'Doughnut!' - Becker & Kyrgios in Twitter war of words
item.description: Boris Becker and Nick Kyrgios exchange words on Twitter after Kyrgios' criticism of Alexander Zverev.

item.title: Liverpool celebrations regrettable, says Premier League chief
item.description: The Premier League's chief executive tells MPs it was "regrettable" Liverpool fans congregated in the city to celebrate their team winning the title.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are Leicester's new lockdown restrictions?
item.description: The city is the first to experience a local lockdown as officials try to curb its coronavirus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
item.description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are air bridges and which countries can I go to?
item.description: Britons will be able to travel to certain places without having to quarantine under new agreements.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: Can we holiday with another family? And other questions
item.description: Questions about support bubbles, and other coronavirus topics.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and lockdown rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing so you can now meet people and carry out a wide range of activities.

item.title: Coronavirus: Has China or the US tested more?
item.description: China and the US both say they have done the most testing for coronavirus - so who's right?

item.title: Where in the world are coronavirus cases rising and falling?
item.description: As the world hits the grim milestone of 10 million confirmed cases, which countries are seeing the biggest rises, and what might be behind them?

item.title: Coronavirus: How will local lockdowns work?
item.description: A local lockdown has been introduced to stop the spread of Covid-19 in Leicester - but how will it work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: Many weddings were cancelled during lockdown, while some will have to change to meet the new rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: 'The love letter to my neighbourhood that helped me flee my country'
item.description: JosÃ© Gregorio MÃ¡rquez was ashamed of the place he grew up, but he came to love it before leaving it forever.
